intro: Aptosimum depressum var. benthamii, commonly known as the Bentham's bluebottle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its blue to purple flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture.
